subject: Re: [junit] Thanks - running out of memory
msgSnippet: ... I caught that. Memory problems in the tests usually mean memory problems in the production code. ... ...at the first sign of trouble, yes. -- J. B. (Joe)
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> I think Robert was talking about adding memory to run the tests, not the
> software.

I caught that. Memory problems in the tests usually mean memory problems
in the production code.

> One of these tests should probably make sure that said software doesn't eat
> up too much memory :-)

...at the first sign of trouble, yes.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
